name: Margery Hill and High Stones (Ethels), High Peak

ai.summary: A demanding 25.7 km UK hike to Margery Hill and High Stones (Ethels) that traverses exposed upland terrain with long ascents and rocky sections. Designed for experienced hikers with solid navigation and stamina.
ai.terrain_summary: Long-distance upland route with uneven, rocky paths and potential boggy patches. Expect steep climbs to elevated points, open exposed sections, and variable weather. Navigation on open moorland is essential; waterproof footing and sturdy boots recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and start early; carry a map and compass (GPS as backup). Stay on marked paths and wear sturdy waterproof boots. Bring sufficient clothing for wind and rain, plus 2–3 liters of water and high-energy food. Inform someone of your planned route and timings; be prepared for rapid weather changes and reduced daylight; consider turning back if visibility drops.
recommended_gear: Fully charged phone with portable battery
Sufficient water (2–3 L) and high-energy snacks
Emergency whistle and lightweight emergency bivvy or space blanket

seo.title: Margery Hill and High Stones (Ethels) Hike – 25.7 km, Hard Route in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the demanding 25.7 km Margery Hill and High Stones (Ethels) hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and gear for a challenging upland trek.
